statement:
The function
$$G(n) \; :=\; \frac{\sigma(n)}{n\ln(\ln{n})} \qquad (n \;=\; 2,\,3,\,4,\,\ldots),$$
in which $\sigma(n)$ means the sum of the positive divisors of $n$,
satisfies the equation $$\limsup_{n\to\infty}\,G(n) \;=\; e^{\gamma}$$
where $\gamma$ is the Euler–Mascheroni constant.

[8]{} : Some asymptotic expressions in the theory of numbers. $-$
*Trans. Amer. Math. Soc.* **14** (1913) 113–122.
